course.subject: ENVR
course.name: Environmental Geographical Information System
course.description: This course will cover a broad spectrum of concepts and practices in Geographical Information System (GIS). It starts with the fundamental concepts and elements in geographic science and technology. Spatial data modeling and integration methods will then be discussed followed by various geospatial analysis approaches for both vector and raster data. Cartographic principles, spatial relationships, projection and coordinate systems will be discussed in-depth. During the course, students will be introduced to contemporary GIS software and apply GIS technology support local and regional environmental planning and management.

reviews.author: wholovescougar
reviews.title: An Extremely Fun Practical GIS Training Course :)
reviews.comment_content:
This course mainly teaches students how to use ArcGIS Pro, a world-renowned GIS commercial software. To be mentioned. this course combines UG and Research PG ENVR Students (i.e., ENVR4330, ENVR5330).  

Couese contents:
- Introduction to GIS
- Vector-based vs Raster-based Spatial Data
- Shapefile
- A wide range of Geoprocessing Functions
- Thiessen Polygon
- Triangulated Irregular Network (TIN) Model
- Interpolation: Inverse Distance Weighting (IDW)
- Interpolation: Spline
- Temporal Spatial Data Analysis
- Raster Interpolation
- Model Validation (e.g., RMSE, ANOVA)
- Geo-referencing Functions
- Geoid, Mapping and Projection
- Geographic and Project Coordinate System
- Raster Analysis: Slope and Aspact
- Urban Morphological Analysis
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Jimmy Chan is a super nice, kind and hilarious HK local professor. You can ask him questions or concerns via email or walk-in.
reviews.comment_grading:
Each component has not been released, but I just know that I got the highest mark in this course, and thus I received an A+ in this course. Feel very great and unexpected, hahaha :)

As the final quiz and final examination count a significantly big proportion, please be careful to answer the questions, and make sure you have used reseasonable/correct ArcGIS geoprocessing functions (e.g., intersect vs spatial join; union; clip; extract values to points; multipart to singlepart)

This course is indeed challenging, especially is the quiz and final exam (only 2.5 hours to complete) but if you know the logic behind the questions and GIS functions, you can find the correct way and answer very fast. :)
reviews.comment_workload:
(1) Two Assignments (each counts for 10%)
(2) One Individual Project (20%) - Five rsearch projects choose one
(3) Final Quiz (30%)
(4) Final Examination (30%)

All deadlines of assignments and projects are in late May, while do not be a deadline fighter LOL (I was a deadline figher eventually..).

reviews.author: KW0_0
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly related to the operation of using ArcGIS and Data management more than teaching through the note.

Required to download a few app for you to use the ArcGIS through the virtual binding, especially for the laptop user.

Highly recement to do most of the exercise by yourself to get understand what's going on.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quick pace during the lesson due to some of the time would be used for program loading LOL. Chan may speed up some step due to the time limitation, ask you to go back and watch Zoom recording.

But Dr. Chan will provide induvial zoom meet if you want to ask him question.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 20%
Individual Project 40%
Quiz 40%

The answer are related to ArcGiS operation to get the correct answer, so it could be easy for most of the people to get pass grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
One Map Assignment
One Individual Project
Final quiz

Will have Mock quiz for you to prepare and ask Chan question for your understanding before the Final quiz

No exam
